file_content.text: So... what's it like, being a Jedi?
The lightsaber's got to be the best part. How do those things work, anyhow?
We've got a fight ahead of us. I'd like to focus.
Enough chatter.
Try it out. Just be careful. An engineer probably needs all his fingers.
See for yourself.
They don't teach lightsaber design in engineering school?
Why so interested?
Oh, right. Sorry.
Walker fired on us. Took a direct hit to our engines... can't level her out....
Escape pods. The engineer can ride with me. We'll find you in Vel'lik!
What just happened?
I'm from the school of rolled-up sleeves and getting your hands dirty.
It's so light! Makes sense... blade's made of plasma, and all.
Jedi = heroes! // T7 = honored to serve
Better than being a Sith. Your Masters are a lot less likely to kill you.
There's a lot of meetings. Other than that, seems like a blast.
Is that a serious question?
I admit, I've always wondered myself. Sir.
Caution: Be wary, master. The engineer may be testing you for weaknesses.
Dreadful! My master is always returning with bruises, burn marks, scabs and indigestion!
Hey, wait up! Phew, you even walk fast.
Mind if I hitch a ride? I think I can help with Vel'lik's defenses--they just aren't thinking creatively.
I'll need all the help I can get. And I'd like to see what "creatively" means.
Sure, come along.
These are fully armed Imperial walkers. Are you sure you can handle it?
I don't know....
What's to handle? You'll be the one fighting them off.
I'm here to protect you against the Empire, not your own stupidity.
Your funeral, pal.
I've lived this long, haven't I?
You the pilot? Lead the way. This is going to be great!
